result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from DCI for hearing on 11-30-22

Defendant Jacob Arthur Retzlaff appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Jacob Arthur Retzlaff.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def consents to appearing by video.  Adj requested; def to appear by video for next hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Plea hearing on November 30, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Clerk attempted to contact DCI and wasn't able to get through.  Offer rec'd and needs to be reviewed w/ defendant, resolution anticipated.  Clerk to make arrangements for defendant to appear by video. 
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Arrangements made for def to appear by phone from DCI for hearing on 10-12-22

Defendant Jacob Arthur Retzlaff in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Jacob Arthur Retzlaff.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Reading of Info waived; NG pleas entered.  Counsel req adj for further negotiations.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Jacob Arthur Retzlaff in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Jacob Arthur Retzlaff.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance. Def waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions def, accepts waiver and binds def over; State to file Info.
Arraignment scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.
(Copy mailed to Def and Def Atty)
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Arthur Retzlaff in court, in custody.  Attorney Edgar A Beltran in court for Jacob Arthur Retzlaff. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def does not qualify for SPD and req court appointed counsel.  Court appoints Atty Wenninger.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 8-15-22. Def on DOC hold. Court sets $1000 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:45 am.
